review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Great quality mouse, but not for everyone
review.review: I believe this mouse is made out of great quality. No creaking in the frame, mouse feet are very smooth, is very light for being wireless, and the sensor is great! But there are two things that really bother me about this mouse that has made me sell this mouse and buy another mouse. First, the switches are terrible. They are cheap Omron switches that do not feel as good as other switches (i.e Razer Viper Mini, which is ironic because it costs $30). If you are going to buy this mouse, learn soldering skills and switch these out for some Kailh 4.0 or 8.0 switches. Second (and biggest issue for me), the shape. When you first grip this mouse, you feel like you are gripping a potato. I have medium sized hands (17 x 9.5 CM or 6 3/4" x 3 1/4" IN) and I prefer to claw grip my mice, which I cannot comfortably claw grip this mouse because it is too long and too tall for my hands. If you have medium sized hands in length, fingertip or palm grip this mouse but don't claw grip this mouse. If you have large hands (especially in length), I highly recommend this mouse because you can claw and fingertip this mouse comfortably, and maybe even palm grip. If you have small hands, there are better sized mice for you guys.

review.title: Best mouse I've ever used!
review.review: I was skeptical at first and even getting it, I was impressed with the weight but wasn't sure the value was there. After using it for several hours, I realized how great of a mouse it is. I love the non-RGB "feature" too! Dialing back RGB makes everything look better. The slides are great, the optional grips are amazing, its just a very solid mouse.With the battery, it charges extremely fast and so far after about 7 hours of use, it's gone down 1%!The last thing I'll say is its amazing the weight without having to resort to honeycomb where they literally make the actual shell itself porous which is simply a bad idea all around. You get the extreme light weight (which I actually love!) mixed with durability and protection.There is nothing I can say about this mouse thats bad so far.. I really am more impressed with it than I thought I would be.Would recommend 10/10

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
review.title: Better then I expected
review.review: I have been wanting to get into sim racing for awhile, and I finally went for it. I knew the full set up I was looking for was going to be expensive, so I decided to stick with Logitech instead of going with thrustmaster or Fanatec. Works great and gives me the amount of feedback I was looking for. I almost bought the Logitech shifter as well, but decided to get a better one that last minute. I highly suggest you spend the extra for the shifter. I've used the Logitech one before, but it isn't as structurally strong, and I felt like a toy. The only downside I had with this steering wheel is the actual wheel size (that's why I upgraded it from the start). It's far too small and changes how you drive. The larger diameter wheel completely changes the driving dynamic and increases the realism.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
review.title: Great Mouse...one annoying flaw!
review.review: I've used logitech mice forever and never thought that I would be able to switch to anything different. I saw some reviews for this right around when my current mouse started acting up. For the price this mouse is insanely good. It is extremely light so if you want a heavy mouse it might not be for you. But it works great in everything i play from shooters to mmo's.My one complaint.... and i'm surprised i haven't seen more of this is the grips they give you. They are just stickers that you put on the right and left side of the mouse (there is also one for each mouse click). After 3 or 4 months they start to peel off at the edges and make the mouse extremely annoying to hold in your hand. If it wasnt for this the mouse would be 5 stars.....i havent really found any sites that sell replacement grips. Why not just build these into the mouse?

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: Has some quirks, but absolutely gets the job done for the amazing price
review.review: The force feedback feels great for a beginner, it's responsive, has many buttons, and the pedals are.. not bad. The leather on the wheel and the wheel itself feels very very nice and sturdy. The buttons are a little cheap though, but that's okay.It has some quirks that you will eventually notice though, not tooo big of a deal personally though.Eventually after regular use, the wheel may start squeaking/hissing when the wheel is turning left.You may run into the problem where the wheel becomes off center, this is usually due to you turning too hard to the left. To fix it, just turn to the right all the way lightly, then just push a little harder and then you'll feel something shift back into place.It's actually really hard to press the shifters behind the wheel if the wheel is turned, since it's locked relative to the wheel. It would be a lot easier if the shifters were attached to the wheel base instead, so they didn't move when you turn.The clamp is a little lackluster, if you turn too hard sometimes the wheel will slide a bit, if you're really going at it I've had it come off of the table. That's rare, and only if you're aggressively drifting on a car with low torque and turn radius haha. None of that applies if you get a rig for the whole setup.Overall, good for the price. Works as intended, stays as intended if you know what to do when it messes up.
product.title: Logitech G Dual-Motor Feedback Driving Force G29 Gaming Racing Wheel with Responsive Pedals for PlayStation 5, PlayStation...

review.review: I've been using a G702 for many years now, and the switches were starting to go, so it was time to upgrade. Well, seeing reviews and knowing some people using this I decided to get it, so I got it and I can say that it's nice, but I like the G702 a lot better.My biggest grip, and this is what seems to be just on the one I got, but the textured covering over the weights is dragging on the mouse pad, which means that the skatez on this mouse are too short. It's an easy fix to just go out and buy new skatez, but, for a new product, I should have to just yet.Other things I am not a fan of is this mouse is good for smaller hands, I feel. Also, the definition between the buttons are not very defined, and I feel you can easily click the wrong button. If the mouse was a little wider, I think it would be a bit more comfortable.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
review.title: The scroll wheel still rattles.....
review.review: i just recieved my mouse today and I have to return it. I had never used the gaming mice from Logitech and i was curious about the G502, and i've tried both the wireless and wired versions now. I've returned it almost immediately. I can't believe how much play is in that scroll wheel. I am an avid scroll wheel user in extended spread sheets and web browsing for work and I use the MX 3 with the same hyper scroll but without the rattle.I've been wanting to try something lower profile and still stay ergonomic and have a free spinning scroll wheel. I thought the 502 in the wireless was it but it rattles. They hollowed the wheel which looks amazing but i can not toss around the mouse from screen to screen, copy/paste cells, email to chrome, and to and from apps listening to that clinking.I'm so disappointed. i was really looking foward to it.The shape is amazing and the weight is lighter than i expected. This seller is also selling it much cheaper than others, so do give them a try. The item is legit and i think logitech needs to work on that stability.Overall i think anyone gaming, working, and productivity would benefit from this sick looking mouse. I would have loved it if the wheel was better.I even purchased a third party charging dock, it would have been the ideal pair.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Double-clicking issue solved
review.review: I really like this mouse. However, like many other users mentioned, after a few months it started developing a problem where it would send an extra click sometimes after releasing a button. Frustrating for sure. I called the Logitech G support/warranty number on their website, and was speaking to a helpful support guy within about 45 seconds. He had a list of things to try to fix the issue before proceeding with the warranty claim. One of those things was to blow air underneath the mouse buttons to clean out any dust/debris that collected there. I did this, and so far (a couple days only) it has fixed my problem. Time will tell if it keeps being an issue, but at least for now just blowing a little air to clear the dust is a simple solution.

It looks like 720p stretched over the entire mat. The rgb is held on with thin wiring i feel like will probably break sooner than later.Some good things though: it is a gaming pad and doesnt slide around. I have a glass desk and the pad doesn't move around so that is a plus. It's not thicker or thinner than other pads i've had so that's fine too. The micro usb hub that controls the rgb is probably the nicest thing about this pad. It's thin and out of the way and the single button control is pretty intuitive.You should get this gaming pad if you are fine with mediocre quality and cheap looking spice to add to your setup. It's not awful, but it's not amazing either.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review.title: How do gaming mice this bad even exist?
review.review: At first this seemed like a decent gaming mouse to use until I got the Glorious Model O Wireless, (check out all Glorious mice, they're much better than this and have a similar design!) but it was flaming garbage. I play a lot of minecraft 1.8.9 which has spam clicking combat and you need pretty high cps to last with many other factors, and I butterfly click, which is putting the pads of your index and middle fingers on one mouse button and rotating them up and down one finger at a time, and on my main mouse which is a cheap lenovo office mouse i got from my teacher for free, i can get up to 17 clicks per second. Butterfly clicking relies on double clicking, and this mouse doesn't double click, which I suppose is a good thing, butI can't click fast at all on it. Since jitter clicking doesnt rely on doubleclicks, I think a good jitter clicker could get like 14 cps on this thing but i dont jitter click because it hurts my arm and you can also get early carpel tunnel. As far as I remember with my experience on this thing, my max cps was 10, VERY VERY RARELY. The sensor also had lots of delay sometimes. Whenever i spun my mouse was when I most realized it. It has bad feet which scratch against your mousepad, but decent dpi and decent rgb lights. Another bad thing is that the macro side buttons arent very sturdy, but very soft instead, and not clicky enough so you can easily press one of them without meaning to and mess yourself up in some games. Also, the LED lights don't have the exact color they have on the amazon thumbnail of this product. Also, I have a personal preference for symmetrical mice, and this one isn't symmetrical, but you can't notice that and it doesn't affect my review. I try drag clicking on this mouse sometimes, which is using friction to drag your finger on a mouse button and get over 50 cps on quality mice by good drag clickers, but this mouse only picks up 1 click. This is a very good mouse for every day use as it still looks pretty sick, but this is NOT a gaming mouse. One more thing. If it had a mouse software to adjust the debounce time and possibly get a high cps, i might consider using this mouse. But it doesn't have a software at all. I spent an hour of my life searching for one when i bought this. Please stick to a more well known brand for gaming materials such as Glorious, Razor, Redragon, or Logitech unless you want to be scammed like me. I'm getting my Glorious Model O Wireless next week, and as my friend only wants an rgb mouse I'm going to be giving this one to him. I do think the model o wireless looks cooler though. At least my efforts won't be for nothing. I don't even play other games with this mouse and never have, as I play minecraft mostly. However, I have seen some reviews on this mouse and only 1 good review by an infamous youtuber who seemed to only like this mouse for its rgb, color, and charging mechanics, as his old mouse ran on batteries, and i'm pretty sure this was before heavy use. It would be better to get a good gaming mouse from a more well-known or popular budget gaming brand. Either way, this is a horrible mouse, so do me a favor and DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT BUYING THIS MOUSE!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Great mouse, did research before buying
review.review: I did my research directly on Razer's website to find the mouse that fit my needs best. I was having issues with my previous Razer mouse, only to find that my mousepad was the cause. I actually put away my Mamba Wireless for this mouse because I prefer the soft cord and typically don't gravitate toward wireless for gaming. If you are looking for a wireless mouse, I would recommend the Mamba wireless. For wired, any of Razer's Speedflex models, including this one. I ultimately chose this one and buying here for price and dpi, as I typically game at 9,000 dpi, but like to change that a bit for different games/gameplay types.Overall, would buy again and recommend as a wired mouse. The pink is a nice color to spice up my rig.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Hyperspeed Wireless Technology - 20K DPI Optical ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Lost Connections, bad lag, poor performance
review.review: I had been looking at this mouse for a while and finally convinced myself to buy one.I was very excited for the new mouse.My somewhat new computer has the RGB fans and lighting, so I was excited to add to my setup with this mouse and mouse dock.Add to this the fact that this is a Razer product (supposedly top tier), I thought I was getting something good.I bought this mouse, received it two days latter, returned it the next day.I let the mouse fully charge before using (per the instructions).Once it was fully charged I started using it for the last part of my work day.I was presenting on a Teams meeting and twice in the hour meeting it lost connection.Luckily I still had my other mouse connected so I was able to use it the second time to finish the meeting.Several other times through the remaining part of the day/evening the mouse would lose connection with the computer, usually requiring me to turn it off then back on again for it to start working.Other times it would lag behind very bad and I would have to wait for it to catch up to what I was trying to do.If this is "hyperspeed" technology, I would hate to see how a normal speed mouse works from Razer.I could not imagine anyone using this for gaming, it is horrible.Finally, I tried to customize the buttons on the mouse through Razer Synapse.I would set the buttons, save the setup, and if I left Razer Synapse open, the buttons would work with no issues.As soon as I closed the Razer application, it is as if the mouse would reset to factory defaults and loose all the settings I had just saved.I tried this multiple times with the same results.I even checked other sites for instructions on how to customize the mouse settings to make sure I was not missing a step, no luck.So, in addition to the loss of connection, and horrible lagging; if I were to keep them mouse I would have to open Razer Synapse every morning, setup the mouse again how I wanted it to be, then leave the application open all day just to make sure it worked as designed.I am new to Razer products like this but not new to computers.I have been working in the IS field for over a decade, and I know how to use, and troubleshoot issues with these devices.This mouse just is not a good mouse and not worth the money at all.Please don't waste your money on this overpriced, underperforming mouse.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Hyperspeed Wireless Technology - 20K DPI Optical ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in Italy on October 9, 2021
review.title: Logitech continua a non sbagliare un colpo
review.review: Ottimo mouse gaming di qualitá:- la ruota click/scorrevole è ideale per passare dal gioco all'uso di Internet, la navigazione delle pagine è resa molto più semplice.- i pesi (1,7 o 4,5 grammi) consentono di regolare idealmente la presa del mouse grazie anche al rivestimento inferiore e sui lati che consente una perfetta scorrevolezza.- la precisione del mouse è eccellente, si puó sentire la differenza con i puntatori ottici. Tuttavia avere i due pulsanti di regolazione della sensibilità (DPI) sul clic sinistro del mouse non è pratico o addirittura fastidioso in caso di clic sfortunato.- la qualità del mouse sembra molto soddisfacente (é molto robusto), il cavo USB è rivestito. Sembra tutto molto solido.- ultimo punto molto positivo, poter salvare la configurazione nella memoria incorporata del mouse è molto pratico soprattutto se lo si utilizza con più PC.
product.title: Logitech Gaming Mouse G500

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Completely useless for my target purpose (gaming)
review.review: I've had a SteelSeries Rival 310 for a couple of years now and am perfectly happy with it, but then I found out about this model which seemed like a straight upgrade to me after watching and reading a couple of reviews. After getting it out of the box, I was excited to test it out in my favorite game, DOTA 2. Very quickly however I found out that unlike the two side buttons of the Rival 310, which are extremely easy and super natural to press, all 5 of the side buttons of the Rival 5 were exceedingly difficult and unnatural to press, and also led to mouse movement due to the force required to press the buttons. Also, my thumb had to be in a very weird and cramped position to be able to press the side buttons at all. The big forward side button was basically impossible to press, and the up/down rocker was very difficult to press as well. From the natural thumb resting position, it requires a significant movement to be able to press even the closest two ("back/forward") buttons, unlike with the Rival 310 where those buttons are basically instant-press as soon as you think about them. Therefore, this mouse is completely unusable for playing Dota 2, and I would guess any other game.I have medium to slightly large sized hands, and I would imagine someone with very large hands / long fingers, or some specific grip style might be able to use the side buttons (I am using a standard grip), but for me they are completely unusable. Again, the Rival 310 side buttons are perfectly usable so I'm unsure why they decided to move them way out of reach.The other features of the mouse are fine, as is the build quality, although I heavily dislike the default-on lighting, and the fact that the RGB lighting settings are NOT stored on the mouse itself, so if you use it with a different PC or laptop on which you don't have the SteelSeries software installed, you are forced to have your mouse glow super bright in random colors. The cable is OK too.I hope they make a "real" upgraded version of the Rival 310, with more side buttons, that are natural to reach, like the two existing ones, and not this "apparent" upgrade which is really a huge downgrade.
product.title: SteelSeries Rival 5 Gaming Mouse with PrismSync RGB Lighting and 9 Programmable Buttons – FPS, MOBA, MMO, Battle Royale – ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Unacceptable Battery Life
review.review: I would have thought battery life would be great considering how quickly the mouse goes to sleep, but what would otherwise be a solid mouse for the price is ruined by terrible battery life. I am having to replace the AAAs in my mouse what feels like every 1-2 weeks.There is a power saving setting in the Steelseries software, but it is locked at 150hz polling rate which makes even browsing the web clunky and unresponsive. I especially notice it in the scroll wheel, which feels like it drops roughly every other click.I would recommend this mouse only if you have a battery charging station within reach of your desk and can live with the inconvenience. I will be replacing mine with a Logitech G305, and I guess this will be a fine emergency backup as it is past the return period.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Probably good, but mine wasn't.
review.review: Right off the bat, it's a comfortable mouse. Feels good for my hands, but your mileage may vary. That's basically where the good experiences end for me though.After a day of using it, the signal would cut out for seconds at a time. Tried a different usb port, tried a different machine entirely, it's either the dongle or the hardware in the mouse itself. Ok no problem, switched it to bluetooth and it worked for a bit but also would cut out occasionally though not as often as over the dongle.Ok, so I began troubleshooting. I downloaded the software and updated the firmware, which didn't help anything really, the mouse still had signal issues. Also of note is that the steelseries pc software is one of the more buggier third party apps I've experienced. At a certain point I needed to jump through hoops to get the mouse to update the DPI profiles properly like rapidly switching back and forth between bluetooth and radio in order to get the software to finally push the updated config to the mouse.So where does that leave you? Well, it's a crapshoot like 9 out of 10 modern "gaming" products. These companies cut corners somewhere, and usually a safe bet for them is to skimp on quality control. Despite this, people seem happy with the mouse, so buy it with free returns only just in case.

Since I could not install the SteelSeries software on my work computer, I was stuck with the distracting rainbow pattern.SteelSeries support was less than helpful and claimed the mouse should have onboard memory.Once I proved the Rival 5 was not working from onboard memory to maintain illumination settings, SteelSeries support stopped responding.I sent this mouse back to Amazon after noticing the computer would lose connection with the mouse multiple times a day.

review.title: Not precise.A LOT of friction.
review.review: I use a gaming mouse but primarily work as a bookkeeper.I wanted a slick/smooth mouse pad.This one has a lot of friction... A LOT.If selecting a date from a small calendar box it is nearly impossible to choose the correct date as the friction makes the mouse jump.I have tried putting baby powder on the pad to ease the friction and still does it.Tried Aquaphor thinking it would lube the pad and still the friction.I do not recommend this mouse pad if your needs are precise movements with a mouse.Clunky gaming, maybe... but not small point and click stuff.

review.title: Another bit of e-waste
review.review: Worked very well out of the box for 2-3 months. All of a sudden it stopped working via bluetooth or the dongle. I have tried multiple batteries. Have tried updating drivers both via Windows and Razer's firmware updater. Have installed Razer's ridiculous software which requires you to create an account just to open the software. NOTHING WILL FIX IT. I looked around different boards and it seems many people have had this issue and there is no solution.I feel like I bought a piece of trash that is now useless. Would not recommend buying. I have always had Logitech mice and am going back to them. The close to 20 years i have been using Logitech mice I have not had to fool with them trying to make the combined mice work like i have with this single Razer mouse.

review.title: First Thoughts
review.review: I've been using a G702 for many years now, and the switches were starting to go, so it was time to upgrade. Well, seeing reviews and knowing some people using this I decided to get it, so I got it and I can say that it's nice, but I like the G702 a lot better.My biggest grip, and this is what seems to be just on the one I got, but the textured covering over the weights is dragging on the mouse pad, which means that the skatez on this mouse are too short. It's an easy fix to just go out and buy new skatez, but, for a new product, I should have to just yet.Other things I am not a fan of is this mouse is good for smaller hands, I feel. Also, the definition between the buttons are not very defined, and I feel you can easily click the wrong button. If the mouse was a little wider, I think it would be a bit more comfortable.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
review.title: The scroll wheel still rattles.....
review.review: i just recieved my mouse today and I have to return it. I had never used the gaming mice from Logitech and i was curious about the G502, and i've tried both the wireless and wired versions now. I've returned it almost immediately. I can't believe how much play is in that scroll wheel. I am an avid scroll wheel user in extended spread sheets and web browsing for work and I use the MX 3 with the same hyper scroll but without the rattle.I've been wanting to try something lower profile and still stay ergonomic and have a free spinning scroll wheel. I thought the 502 in the wireless was it but it rattles. They hollowed the wheel which looks amazing but i can not toss around the mouse from screen to screen, copy/paste cells, email to chrome, and to and from apps listening to that clinking.I'm so disappointed. i was really looking foward to it.The shape is amazing and the weight is lighter than i expected. This seller is also selling it much cheaper than others, so do give them a try. The item is legit and i think logitech needs to work on that stability.Overall i think anyone gaming, working, and productivity would benefit from this sick looking mouse. I would have loved it if the wheel was better.I even purchased a third party charging dock, it would have been the ideal pair.
product.title: Logitech G502 Hero High Performance Gaming Mouse Special Edition, Hero 16K Sensor, 16 000 DPI, RGB, Adjustable Weights, 11...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review.title: The mouse is fine, but the mandatory G HUB sofware is awful
review.review: So Logitech decided to discontinue their software for various devices and consolidate them into on grand app to rule them all: G HUB. Not a bad strategy, but the execution was terrible.The mouse itself is pretty good, but there is no point extolling its virtues, since you shouldn't buy it anyway. In fact, you should not buy any Logitech wireless produce until they've fixed G HUB. Or eradicated it, hired a new engineering team, and written something better to replace it. Or, you know, just reverted to the LGS app that their older mice used that worked just fine for years.There are many reviews detailing G HUB's failings, so I won't list all of them here. I'll add my latest experience to the pile:I got the mouse and installed G HUB several months ago on a system with Windows 8.1. Today, I used the in-app button to upgrade to the latest version. But it turns out the latest version is only compatible with Windows 10. So it tried to upgrade itself and hung forever instead, showing me the cutesy animation that Logitech's engineering department apparently spent their time on instead of doing QA. I didn't even get the courtesy of an error message.As a programmer myself, I can tell you that's an inexcusable, novice, facepalm-grade error. An auto-updater should *always* perform proper version and requirements checks.Anyway, I headed to Logitech's site to find an installer for the earlier Windows 8 compatible version. I knew it existed, since just an hour before it was up and running on my system. But no luck, they now offer Windows 10 or Mac only. So then off to reddit, where quickly I found the hidden link to the older Win7 and Win8 versions. Pay no mind to the "There are no Downloads for this Version" message! It's there, or at least it was today, though it may be gone by the time you need it.That installer then failed because it was confused by the current, corrupt installation. So I spent some time ripping that one out by the roots from multiple file system and registry locations. After pausing for a moment to say goodbye to the mouse settings/macros I spent time writing, now all gone, I was able to reinstall it.The whole affair reminded me of this bit from the HHGTTG:“But the plans were on display…”“On display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.”“That’s the display department.”“With a flashlight.”“Ah, well, the lights had probably gone.”“So had the stairs.”“But look, you found the notice, didn’t you?”“Yes,” said Arthur, “yes I did. It was on display in the bottom of a locked filing cabinet stuck in a disused lavatory with a sign on the door saying ‘Beware of the Leopard.”

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Can't Recommend
review.review: This mouse has really been a disappointment.Battery life is nowhere near what I was expecting. I replace batteries in my M510 maybe every 8 month's. That mouse is used 8 hours a day for work. Since I got this in July I have had to replace the batteries three times already (almost monthly).Functionally, this mouse would be terrible for any type of FPS. Half the time the first click I make doesn't register and I have to click again. I haven't experienced the double clicks that others have reported, but they may only be a matter of time. The two main buttons overhang the front of the mouse, so if you bump it into anything while moving it, you end up with random clicks.And last but definitely not least, the G-Hub software is absolute garbage. The interface is terrible and difficult to use. Nothing is where you expect it be and you have to click thru different screens to do basic things like remap buttons. It is buggy as hell, locking up when trying to update, requiring uninstalling and reinstalling it to get it to work. Half the time the profiles you get put in and saved don't activate when they should. For G-Hub alone I would say to stay away from any Logitech product that uses it.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Excellent physical design, absolutely unusable due to GHub.
review.review: I had my previous Logitech gaming mouse for almost 10-years before it gave up on life. So I went for this G604.It feels great in my hand, cradles my thumb perfectly and the buttons are all accessible for my tiny lady hands. Excellent design!But... The Ghub software? Randomly drops profiles so none of the programmed buttons work. Just randomly. It makes the mouse totally unusable. I will be in the middle of a project I rely on macro'd buttons to do for work? Mouse decides to stop working. I will be gaming and try to hit a macro? Bam! Dead!Trying to find a way to load the profile onboard is obtuse. This mouse is harder to program than units with more buttons were 10-years ago.Thing is, I trusted Logitech enough to throw out the package so I cannot even return this failure of a device. Ghub will spend hours trying to update and fail to, which leads to uninstalling and reinstalling just to use the %^&%^ mouse to do basic ^&%&^ mouse things. I have never had this kind of issue with Logitech devices and I have been a loyal customer for decades.Looks like I will be dropping $300 to buy a new copy of the same Logitech gaming mouse I got 10-years ago, because I know that it will survive being used for 16-hours a day for close to 10-years and remain a viable, reliable option until USB technology is completely phased out of PCs.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: You get what you pay for
review.review: Where does all your money go and why is it so much? That's the $150 question for everybody. The TLDR is that it's incredibly well built, fully wireless, responsive, and the lightest mouse on the market. And it's pearly white.I don't know what other relevant details I can give. This mouse has been stress-tested by the best in the tech. industry and Logitech weren't lying, this mouse is FAST. It has incredibly low latency, very good battery life (I mean...there's zero RGB lighting), and is quite possibly the safest shape a mouse can come in. If you don't consider your hands much larger or smaller than most people, it will probably be comfortable holding this mouse.The visual design is intelligent. It has this elegance that isn't the embarrassing "gamer" stylings of other products but isn't so minimalistic that you wouldn't immediately recognize this mouse at first glance. Anybody who's ever used this mouse knows exactly what this feels and looks like.Is this mouse necessary? Absolutely not. I think the only thing more over-the-top than this mouse is the amount of R&D and feedback Logitech went through to create one of the best mice in PC gaming. I do prefer the Razer Viper Ultimate over this because I prefer the texture and shape. I am also bothered that a $150 computer mouse looks almost too simple. Also, in my opinion, the Viper Ultimate doesn't feel that much heavier than this. I wanted to note that, in case anybody wanted a cheaper alternative.Overall, this mouse is a flex, or for anybody who wants to go out of their way to spend time and money on their gaming hobby (gaming career maybe?). I considered buying this since it launched and was not disappointed. Here's to hoping I get my $150 out of this mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Great quality mouse, but not for everyone
review.review: I believe this mouse is made out of great quality. No creaking in the frame, mouse feet are very smooth, is very light for being wireless, and the sensor is great! But there are two things that really bother me about this mouse that has made me sell this mouse and buy another mouse. First, the switches are terrible. They are cheap Omron switches that do not feel as good as other switches (i.e Razer Viper Mini, which is ironic because it costs $30). If you are going to buy this mouse, learn soldering skills and switch these out for some Kailh 4.0 or 8.0 switches. Second (and biggest issue for me), the shape. When you first grip this mouse, you feel like you are gripping a potato. I have medium sized hands (17 x 9.5 CM or 6 3/4" x 3 1/4" IN) and I prefer to claw grip my mice, which I cannot comfortably claw grip this mouse because it is too long and too tall for my hands. If you have medium sized hands in length, fingertip or palm grip this mouse but don't claw grip this mouse. If you have large hands (especially in length), I highly recommend this mouse because you can claw and fingertip this mouse comfortably, and maybe even palm grip. If you have small hands, there are better sized mice for you guys.

After using it for several hours, I realized how great of a mouse it is. I love the non-RGB "feature" too! Dialing back RGB makes everything look better. The slides are great, the optional grips are amazing, its just a very solid mouse.With the battery, it charges extremely fast and so far after about 7 hours of use, it's gone down 1%!The last thing I'll say is its amazing the weight without having to resort to honeycomb where they literally make the actual shell itself porous which is simply a bad idea all around. You get the extreme light weight (which I actually love!) mixed with durability and protection.There is nothing I can say about this mouse thats bad so far.. I really am more impressed with it than I thought I would be.Would recommend 10/10

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Best Mouse I've used
review.review: As an unfortunate victim of two Razer mice (Razer Naga Trinity Gaming, Razer Deathadder) that had the MOUSE1 button (primary click) start double-clicking after than less a year each, I moved over to the wired Logitech G500. The G500 lasted about 2 years, which for the pricepoint, was fantastic to me compared to the 1 year lifespan of the pricier Razer mice that broke.So, I got this mouse, the G502, since the Logitech 500 lifespan forced me out of Razer. So far the G502 has treated me really well with its functionality. The mouse software, G HUB, lets you set almost any Windows shortcuts per buttons, such as having 'Copy' (Ctrl + C) on your MOUSE4, and 'Paste' on your MOUSE5. Has good functionality across apps too, like Discord, where you can mute yourself at anytime with a button click.For gaming it feels smooth, with adjustable DPI settings also at a button click (by default). I don't use the mouse weights at all just because... I don't really see the point for myself.***Will update this review when the mice breaks, to give a good idea of its relative lifespan. Hopefully >2 years :)
product.title: Logitech G502 Lightspeed Wireless Gaming Mouse with Hero 16K Sensor and Lightsync RGB & G Powerplay Wireless Charging Syst...

This time its the software, the sensitivity that I have set does not match the time it takes for the software to load, to "snap" into that speed that I am comfortable with. The problem is that b4 my PC starts, the software isnt detected, the my mouse is incredibly fast for no reason, its like everytime I load my pc I have to wiggle around and slow it down to type my pin to log into windows, but here is the thing, my computer has good specs, i9 10k , 980 samsung SSD... I WANT TO LOG IN AND CLICK ON AN ICON OR TYPE IN SEARCH BAR FOR WHAT APP I CAN USE, IT TAKES A FKIN MINUTE TO LOAD FOR THE CLUNKY FAST MOUSE MOVEMENT TO TURN OFF!!!!!!! BAD JUST BAD LOGITEC, THIS ISNT SO LOGICAL IS IT NOW?

review.review: This mouse looks tall in the pictures but it's more shallow than the MX Master by Logitech. It's super light weight but if you play games that require you to lift the mouse and reposition, it handles poorly. It's heavier on the back side and my hand is really big so when I lift the mouse, I use my thumb and pinky and the front end tilts up and I lose my grip on this thing. I also have carpal tunnel and the MX Master is ergonomic and doesn't trigger it. I feel like if I played on this mouse, it would.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Double-clicking issue solved
review.review: I really like this mouse. However, like many other users mentioned, after a few months it started developing a problem where it would send an extra click sometimes after releasing a button. Frustrating for sure. I called the Logitech G support/warranty number on their website, and was speaking to a helpful support guy within about 45 seconds. He had a list of things to try to fix the issue before proceeding with the warranty claim. One of those things was to blow air underneath the mouse buttons to clean out any dust/debris that collected there. I did this, and so far (a couple days only) it has fixed my problem. Time will tell if it keeps being an issue, but at least for now just blowing a little air to clear the dust is a simple solution.

review.review: After using a m100 mouse for 5+ years it was hard to get into the “gaming” mouse market. I tried Most of the top of the line gaming mice but my hand would always cramp up after using them as I was used to the unique shape of my Logitech m100. This is the same size as the m100 and I love the raised rather than recessed side buttons. It helps to prevent accidental side button clicks. My only gripe is that the clicks are slightly easier to operate than the m100 but that’s to be expected with a gaming mouse. The fact that it’s cheaper than most competitors is a win win too!

review.title: @ doa's
review.review: TLDR: I ordered this mouse because it is a classic, and great mouse unlike most mice. I've owned one before at it was always reliable, never broke/died. It's my favorite for alot of reasons. However, weather it's the sellers fault, or the distributor, these mice may be fake. I've had 2 of them go bad on me within 2 weeks of use. Not kidding. A numpad button wentbad on the first one, and the 2nd one is very slow for a min or 2 on computer startup. This continued to happen, until today when it just was slow on startup, never went back to normal, and the rmb just completely stopped functioning. I don't know if I'd even want a replacement at this point. Just a refund.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Avoid.Build quality is not what it used to be.
review.review: My original g600 served me faithfully for 3 years without issue before the side buttons started wearing out...requiring progressively more force in order to register before dying completely.I was quite satisfied with the Logitech's performance in that time frame and decided to retire it in favor of a newer g600.I ordered the replacement g600 in September 2021, and it arrived with the middle mouse button broken, despite the packaging being pristine.After returning the second g600 through Amazon, I received a *third* g600, and the side buttons started wearing out in less than a month.Even without the broken buttons, the two replacements clearly exhibit a lower build quality from the previous generation, feeling poorly-put-together using cheaper components -- like using a rubber cord rather than a sturdy, braided one.Normally I don't take time to leave reviews, but I am going to leave this here for anyone looking at a g600 for gaming after October 2021.Go with another mouse.I'm not sure how the Razer Nagas are performing but I might look into Corsair instead.RIP Logitech...I just wish you cared about the quality of your products.
product.title: Logitech G600 MMO Gaming Mouse, RGB Backlit, 20 Programmable Buttons

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: You get what you pay for
review.review: Where does all your money go and why is it so much? That's the $150 question for everybody. The TLDR is that it's incredibly well built, fully wireless, responsive, and the lightest mouse on the market. And it's pearly white.I don't know what other relevant details I can give. This mouse has been stress-tested by the best in the tech. industry and Logitech weren't lying, this mouse is FAST. It has incredibly low latency, very good battery life (I mean...there's zero RGB lighting), and is quite possibly the safest shape a mouse can come in. If you don't consider your hands much larger or smaller than most people, it will probably be comfortable holding this mouse.The visual design is intelligent. It has this elegance that isn't the embarrassing "gamer" stylings of other products but isn't so minimalistic that you wouldn't immediately recognize this mouse at first glance. Anybody who's ever used this mouse knows exactly what this feels and looks like.Is this mouse necessary? Absolutely not. I think the only thing more over-the-top than this mouse is the amount of R&D and feedback Logitech went through to create one of the best mice in PC gaming. I do prefer the Razer Viper Ultimate over this because I prefer the texture and shape. I am also bothered that a $150 computer mouse looks almost too simple. Also, in my opinion, the Viper Ultimate doesn't feel that much heavier than this. I wanted to note that, in case anybody wanted a cheaper alternative.Overall, this mouse is a flex, or for anybody who wants to go out of their way to spend time and money on their gaming hobby (gaming career maybe?). I considered buying this since it launched and was not disappointed. Here's to hoping I get my $150 out of this mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Great quality mouse, but not for everyone
review.review: I believe this mouse is made out of great quality. No creaking in the frame, mouse feet are very smooth, is very light for being wireless, and the sensor is great! But there are two things that really bother me about this mouse that has made me sell this mouse and buy another mouse. First, the switches are terrible. They are cheap Omron switches that do not feel as good as other switches (i.e Razer Viper Mini, which is ironic because it costs $30). If you are going to buy this mouse, learn soldering skills and switch these out for some Kailh 4.0 or 8.0 switches. Second (and biggest issue for me), the shape. When you first grip this mouse, you feel like you are gripping a potato. I have medium sized hands (17 x 9.5 CM or 6 3/4" x 3 1/4" IN) and I prefer to claw grip my mice, which I cannot comfortably claw grip this mouse because it is too long and too tall for my hands. If you have medium sized hands in length, fingertip or palm grip this mouse but don't claw grip this mouse. If you have large hands (especially in length), I highly recommend this mouse because you can claw and fingertip this mouse comfortably, and maybe even palm grip. If you have small hands, there are better sized mice for you guys.

After using it for several hours, I realized how great of a mouse it is. I love the non-RGB "feature" too! Dialing back RGB makes everything look better. The slides are great, the optional grips are amazing, its just a very solid mouse.With the battery, it charges extremely fast and so far after about 7 hours of use, it's gone down 1%!The last thing I'll say is its amazing the weight without having to resort to honeycomb where they literally make the actual shell itself porous which is simply a bad idea all around. You get the extreme light weight (which I actually love!) mixed with durability and protection.There is nothing I can say about this mouse thats bad so far.. I really am more impressed with it than I thought I would be.Would recommend 10/10

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
review.title: Buena estetica, buen diseño, buenos switches.
review.review: Comienzo la review diciendo que el teclado se siente tal y como se vee, bastante premium. Sus retroiluminacion es bastante prominente y elegante. Se puede sentir al momento de sacarlo y usarlo, que es de buena calidad. Tanto en la construccion como en el cableado. El diseño es bastante bonito y, un poco mas distinto a lo "gamer tradicional", dado que combina blanco negro, con el diseño de KDA de League of Legends (en lo personal a mi me da igual eso, me gusta mas por el diseño).Eso si, cosas a cosas a considerar:-El cable tiene una especie de sujecion especial, puedes utilizar cualquier micro usb (si, no usa usb C) pero da la sensacion que se desconectara en algun momento.-Las keycaps no dejan una buena sensacion, se sienten un poco extrañas y puedo detectar que se van a desgastar rapido, ojo con esto. Ademas, encontrar un set de keycaps que cubra todas las teclas, es complicado, dado que las unidades de algunas teclas como el espacio (5.75u), el shift, y los ctrl, no son estandar o OEM.-El software, quizas puede generarle algunas complicaciones a algunos usuarios.En resumen:Pros:-Teclado premium en su mayoria, buena construccion.-Iluminacion bastante prominente.-Switches brown bastante comodos, no son tan ruidosos como los blue, de la version original de este teclado (g pro).-Diseño unico hasta el momento.Cons:-Keycaps un poco incomodas, con un desgaste un poco mas acelerado-Incompatibilidad con todas las keycaps estandares, dado el formato especial de logitech.-Switches no intercambiables.En mi puntuacion el dare un 7/10, debido a las limitantes que presentan las keycaps tanto para un cambio a futuro, como sus unidades especiales.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
review.title: Works great with SPAD. Rotary buttons will break with use.
review.review: I have three of these FIPs. I bought them one at a time as each one broke. About a year of pretty frequent use, one of the rotary knobs (the one most used) breaks off from each FIP. I replaced the first one with the second one, the second one with the third one. It's whichever button you rotate the most that will break. The tiny plastic connection is ridiculously small and weak. Button stubs still turn with a small screwdriver, or turn with mouse on screen. But that kind of negates the feature of having "real knobs" on the device.I recommend planning on replacing them in about a year if you flight sim frequently. You can use the broken ones for gauges that don't require a lot of button twisting.Download/purchase SPAD. It's an interface between lots of 3rd party gauges and this device. Go look at the free sample gauges and the paid gauges. They're only a couple dollars per gauge. If you can afford 125 bucks (x3 or more) for this piece of hardware, ten bucks for a couple of software gauges is a no brainer.Despite the broken knob thing, I'm still giving it four stars. It's just fabulous to have the gauge sitting "over there" instead of mousing/scrolling around on screen to see the gauge. Separate gauges like this encourage the quick look/cross check that we should be doing anytime there's gauges on a machine.I wish they'd beef up the knob to rotary controller connection. I'll likely buy more of these.
product.title: Logitech G Pro Flight Instrument Panel

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2021
review.title: Did not work on Mac running X-Plane 11
review.review: I wanted to use this with X-Plane 11.5 running on a Mac.Logitech only provides Windows drivers.Some individuals have created solutions for Mac users and posted them to X-Plane.org but you will need some serious programming skills to get them to work.(By serious I mean you’ll need to understand data refs and you'll end up having to map each of the buttons using code you wrote or modified from others).A better option in my opinion is to have another computer running Windows 10 that is networked with your Mac with the Flight Radio plugged into the Windows PC.Of course, you'll have the expense of another computer and another paid copy of X-Plane 11.Also, I found out this thing needs to be plugged into a USB 2.0 port and does not like USB 3.0.Finally, I'm not 100% sure, but I don't think this radio will simulate the new 8.33 frequency spacing.Perhaps another can comment on that.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review.title: Not bad for the price
review.review: Usualy I try to steer clear of Logetech brand stuff because their quality isn't as good as it used to be, but there aren't very many options at least that are affordable out there when it comes to HOTAS suppoted flight sticks. I would try a Thrustmaster but they are way overpriced, some costing as much as $300 to $500! For $30 it seems to work alright. Its a little stiffer than I'd like and it could use more programable buttons. It only has 6 on the stick and 6 on one side. There is clearly a bunch of room on the other side for another 6 buttons but for some reason Logetech decided to waste the space with the logo that will be rarely looked at when in use. The throttle is designed better than my old Attack 3 which failed a few years back. It works with Windows 10 PCs and FSX Steam/Dovetail edition supports it. Hooked it up to my PC and installed the drivers automaticaly and worked intsantly. Shipping was fast as usual. Came within 24 hours as usual with Prime items. They could have at least privacy wrapped it for shipping. It came in retail packing with no attempt at hiding the contents. Had I not been home for a while when it arrived some passerby would have probably been tempted to steal it from my doorstep. They don't have to pack it into another box, they could at least privacy wrap it with non-clear plastic wrap. This really aught to be an option for those that want their package hidden.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
review.title: Looks identical to the one I bought as a kid 15 years ago, but it sure doesn’t feel the same.
review.review: My previous version of this joystick lasted around 15 years and worked perfectly the entire time, but a drop onto concrete forced me to find a replacement.I was amazed to find the “same” model still being made, so I ordered one as soon as it was in stock. For half the cost of what I paid long ago, it’s okay - but the internal parts cannot possibly be the same in this newer unit and the fit/finish is mediocre.(The included pictures highlight rough/sharp pieces of plastic, and seams that don’t fit together well. I would have saved my old joystick for comparison photos if I knew these wouldn’t be the same.)The yaw/twist axis is sensitive but slightly unsettled on center, forcing me to calibrate a wider dead-zone than I would prefer to cancel it out. The other axis work fine without issue though.The trigger had a sharp plastic burr I needed to sand off. The seams on the stick itself are aligned poorly and feel uncomfortable compared to the old unit, with sharp edges in spots. Also, although not a real concern, the throttle feels almost gritty (compared to the silky smooth version I was used to).Overall it’s okay if you get one at bargain price, but I’d personally pay more for a version built like they used to be. If you buy one, I hope you get a better example than I did!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021
review.title: Works perfect with MSFS 2020
review.review: I did not even download the Logitec drivers, but used (Payware) Spad.Next instead. Spad.Next was designed for these Logitech panels (they used to be branded Saitek before Logitech purchased that company).Spad lets you assign any command whatsoever to this panel (also the Radio Panel and the Switch Panel). You can see how versatile Spad is by watching Youtube videos by vadermike777.You can see how to use Spad.Next with Logitech panels by watching Les O'Reilly videos on Youtube. Les calls them for exapmple: (Sim Video) New User #1 | SPAD.neXtWhich is #1 in the series (getting started with Logitech panels and Spad.Next).The advantage of Spad.Next is that you can change the panel functions (what each switch and knob does, or how it does it). And you can use a different profile for each plane. It will load the right profile with the plane for you. (You cannot change any panel function with the official Logitech drivers)!Example: another panel is the Logitech Switch Panel (this one is the Multi Panel). On it is a switch labeled 'Panel Light'. Except most planes don't have a panel light (lights behind the gauges). Instead they use an overhead dome light (e.g. the default Cessna 172). With Spad.Next you tell the Logitech panel to use the rocker switch labeled 'PANEL LIGHT' to turn on and off the dome light instead of the panel light. If you are running the Logitech official plugin driver then you are out of luck. You won't be able to see the gauges at night using that switch. Because you can't reprogram the panel. But you can very easily reprogram them with Spad.Next.I have 3 Logitech panels: Switch Panel, Multi Panel, Radio Panel. They join together with thumb screws (stacked on top each other, but they have could have been joined together the same way side by side). They tilt back to make them easier to read. I have to lean my vertical stack against something because of that backward tilt (to hold them up). I use the elevation desk stand that my 32" monitor sits on. The Logitech panel stack just leans back against that stand which hold them very steady.Five Stars!

No matter how many times I restarted my computer, unplugged and put it back in. I contacted Logitech support and they basically told me that if I what I was doing changed nothing, then oh well. They took over Saitek’s original drivers so it links o Logitech’s drivers, but Logitech doesn’t provide the drivers for the module to be recognized properly by the computer. Overall the only reason this has 2 stars is for the impressive build quality. Don’t recommend buying unless you can figure out a way to recode it to work.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review.title: Great so far, but needs lubricant
review.review: So far, the joystick feels very high quality and works great. It doesn't feel plasticy or flimsy at all. The software is mostly good enough, but you're going to be googling how to make certain things work pretty often.Firstly, the joystick was nearly unusable out of the box. The metal ring that the spring pushes against was grinding and catching on the plastic ring of the base to the extent that I couldn't make any fine movements. I applied a tiny bit of chapstick (not the best, but its what I had) and the grinding decreased completely except for one spot. After a day of use, that spot has disappeared and the joystick moves as smoothly as butter. If you're having a similar issue, give it a bit of grease and play with it for a while.If you're going to install the software, you're going to have to make a few adjustments if you want to use the clutch button ( i ) and the pinkie trigger. For games like elite dangerous and war thunder, which have built in presets for this HOTAS, with the software installed, you'll need to disable clutch mode in windows and delete the pinkie trigger settings in the software. You can google how to do these; it takes about a minute to do both.While you're in the windows settings disabling clutch mode, you should also decrease the brightness of the LEDs (which you can customize to a large extent). They're excessively bright by default (as pretty much all things are), and I found just barely above zero to be pleasant.This HOTAS is definitely not without issue, and only time will tell if it lasts long, but so far I would recommend it highly. All the problems (so far) are solvable and only briefly annoying.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Great keyboard with surprisingly defeatured keycaps
review.review: First, I'll agree with every 5 star review out there.This keyboard is amazing.That being said, I'll state that the keyboard was not purchased for gaming.I use it for typing in a home office environment.I love everything about this keyboard but one small detail I'm finding to be incredibly annoying.So much so, I'm surprised more reviewers don't it out.The keycaps illuminate, which is great!All except the shift characters are NOT illuminated.Lights down low and you're looking for the '&' symbol?Better turn on the lights.The RGB on the keyboard is completely useless for any of the shift characters.This sounds like a small gripe, but it's huge if you wish to use this keyboard for general typing in a low light environment.For that defeature alone I do NOT recommend this keyboard for home office users that do more than game.Still, I give this keyboard a 4/5 rating.It's a 5/5 rating if you never have need for illuminated shift characters.If you do need a full set of visual characters in a low light environment, then this keyboard will feel more like a 2/5 rating.It's extremely limiting for that usage.Overall, I do NOT recommend this keyboard for those wanting a duel purpose gaming/office keyboard.
product.title: Logitech G PRO Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Ultra Portable Tenkeyless Design, Detachable Micro USB Cable & G502 Lightspeed ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021
review.title: A good mechanical keyboard for those who want their experience to be "one and done"
review.review: I have owned several mechanical keyboards over the past 3 years. Ranging from cheap crap like Red Dragon, to consumer stuff like Corsair and Razer, as well as some of the higher end custom boards like the TOFU60 and some KBDfans stuff.For the money, I think you can do SO much better. While I appreciate the RGB quality and the sheer amount of endless RGB customization the GHUB software allows you, that is about the only thing I can rate highly.Construction is not totally terrible for a board built primarily out of plastic. But it is very hollow sounding and does not have much substance to it when typing. Has a nice weight to it and the adjustable angle stands are nice and have been useful. Stabilizers are average, but definitely nothing special. Why are they STILL using MICRO USB? It literally would cost them less than $0.30 to use USB-C instead. I dont get it. Keycaps dont seem to be double shot PBT, but theyre decent quality nonetheless. Nice RGB shine through. Switches are proprietary Logitech Blue clicky switches. They are pretty meh. If you like the sound of a loud dry keypress with significant amount of travel and play, then youll like it. Otherwise, if youve used boards that have a more consistent and overall smooth feeling keypress, this will not be a treat to use.I think this keyboard is half decent for most folks who want something they can buy once and not have to think about again after that. But if you have very high standards, have used modded or custom or just better quality keyboards prior, this one will very likely not be a great experience.Personally, I went out on a limb because I finished building my latest PC much quicker than I anticipated and have since sold the TOFU60 I had and my backup board which was a Corsair. So I bought this on a whim wanting to give a GPRO product a try. However after a month of use, I am going to revert to building a good starter 60% or maybe TKL mechanical keyboard since that can be done for under 150 and overall can feel 10 times better than this GPRO. :lTLDR6/10. Would recommend to people wanting something that they dont have to worry about ever again after purchasing. Anyone else, I would suggest taking a pass and getting an entry level custom starter board that has intent to be modded down the road.
product.title: Logitech G PRO Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Ultra Portable Tenkeyless Design, Detachable Micro USB Cable & G502 Lightspeed ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
review.title: These are not Brown switches, I misread thinking and hoping for a quieter version
review.review: Can't bring this to the office, which is fine since I'm work from home perpetually.That said, I've never liked the haptic feedback of blue cherry mx, and was hoping for brown or romer G.I like the tenkeyless for the real estate, but was disappointed that there was no USB slot on the side/back for use.I'm also not sure about the weird proprietary version of their USB H.R Geiger alien genital thing they've got going on, but if I don't return this It'll be out of laziness and I probably won't mind in the end.The lightsync is nifty when paired with Logitech G560 speakers and a mouse if you care about that sort of thing, though it's pretty dumb that Logitech has you download "Logitech Gaming Software" which does nothing but open, make you download logitech hub, and serves no real purpose but that.That's intentional bloat and Logitech knows better, so I base my scores on these things more than my mistake going for Blue switches.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
review.title: Microphone is awful
review.review: The output of the sound was 7/10. Good for gaming, I could hear well and was able to determine direction pretty easily.The input quality of the microphone was -1/10. Every time I got into a call with someone, I was told how bad my microphone sounded. I spent an entire weekend going over every single setting trying to get the microphone to sound better, but there was nothing I could do. For the price of these headphones I absolutely expect a microphone of quality.I used the Corsair Void Pro for years, that was a fantastic all around. I recently got a Logitech keyboard and mouse, and wanted to complete the set. Total mistake. If you can deal with being told how crappy your microphone sounds all the time, then it might be a decent decision. Otherwise, I'd recommend going with almost any other headset.

Well good luck navigating the Sisyphean menus and links in the support menu many of which flat out lie about where they're taking you.I register my product and my profile says I have no products. review.title: Amazing sound quality, but cuts off sometimes
review.review: These muffle my ears so much that people get frustrated with me for not answering them, which is exactly what I want because why would I want to deal with the outside world? I used these to play Resident Evil 7 and the sounds were so haunting that I can no longer sleep for more than a few hours at a time. I didn't realize how much of a difference sound quality can make for a horror game until then, these would be an easy 5 stars but sometimes the sound will just randomly cut off completely for a second. It's rare, but it does make me worry for how long these will last. 4.5/5

review.title: This headset is a great headset BUT!
review.review: Pros__________________________________________________________________________________1). I love how the headset feels on my head, light and breathable. (USING -> Cloth Earpads.)2). The sound is not too loud in any department or quiet. (IE: balanced great) [PS. Comes with software to balance sound to your liking.]3). The cable is braded so it is strong and not prone to break.4). The headsets clamping force is light so it does not hurt your head from prolonged wear.5). The headset cable is detachable and replaceable so no big deal if you loose it or break it. This also means you can get your own custom cable.6). The software installs easy and is a hub for all Logitech devices and can tune the headset to your liking then save that to the on board memory for traveling use.Cons_________________________________________________________________________________1). The headset controls on the cable SUCK! It gets in the way and is awkward to get it in a comfy position.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
review.title: Great sound quality, comfortable, well built gaming headset
review.review: The media could not be loaded. The Logitech G PRO wired stereo headset for Windows is one of the best headphones I had used it for over 60 hours before writing this review, I wanted to make sure everything will work well since is renewed but so far so good, no complaints.The fit is snug and comfortable on my head and are not too bad even when I am wearing my glasses.The headband is made of steel and aluminum for strength and weight. Soft supple fake leather ear pads surround your ears, and combine that with the memory foam inserts and you have the makings of a truly comfortable fit and feel for your ears. These have 50mm drivers that provide a great sound out of the box and if you download the Logitech G HUB software, it gets even better. You can choose between some pre-defined EQ settings or you can customize and save your own.A 6’ 3.5mm headphone cable that feels sturdy and think is included. There is an inline control that you can adjust the volume and mute. I found that the placement of the control is just a bit too close to the headphones and I would have preferred it to be a few inches lower than it is.The microphone is detachable and has pretty good flexibility in it’s stalk with only the first inch of it not being able to be adjusted, but the rest of it is movable. Quality is really good as well and anyone I asked how it sounded said it was clear and loud.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: I really didnt think i would like this mouse. I couldnt have been more wrong. 10/10.
review.review: Im honestly surprised. Ive had issues with razer in the past, and have been slowly gravitating away from their products. I really like the g502, but the scroll wheel thing is dumb and kind of useless. I use that button for remapping, and its kind of important for my muscle memory.The battery life is great, i havent had it die once and i have rgb on, using it for about a week. RND is great on it, good quality, smooth clicks on both main actuators. It fits really nicely in my hand (mostly claw grip, but i rest my palm on the back, medium hands). The pads on the bottom are literal butter. It glides with 0 friction, even on my admittedly worn mouse mat.Honestly a great mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Amazing mouse by far from razer
review.review: I've been a razer member for over 2 years and have been impressed with every product I've gotten, but this one out of them all, was easily the best. It's both cost effective and has amazing lighting features, not to mention a ton of programmable buttons. It's got 2 buttons to both lower and raise the dpi settings, 3 side buttons that are programmable, along with hyperkeys. What that is is the ability to combine 2 or more buttons to make 1 programmable action and u can make a ton of them. I'd personally recommend this mouse to anyone who loves long lasting products, but also amazing RGB. Also will look great in ANY setup. #teamrazer

review.review: I've been a razer member for over 2 years and have been impressed with every product I've gotten, but this one out of them all, was easily the best. It's both cost effective and has amazing lighting features, not to mention a ton of programmable buttons. It's got 2 buttons to both lower and raise the dpi settings, 3 side buttons that are programmable, along with hyperkeys. What that is is the ability to combine 2 or more buttons to make 1 programmable action and u can make a ton of them. I'd personally recommend this mouse to anyone who loves long lasting products, but also amazing RGB. Also will look great in ANY setup. #teamrazer

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review.title: Great for everything but the charger
review.review: I love how this mouse just fits in my hand. I thought that the light feel that it had coming out of the box would be a detraction from the quality, but I see how it glides with ease across the pad. I love the throttle bar for precise photoshopping and sniping in video games. Customization is beyond my needs, but great at the default settings. Very responsive and the programmable LED array is sweet! The charger is hard to line up and it must be charged more often than expected. I think there could be some improvement on that on the next iteration.
product.title: Razer Basilisk Ultimate Wireless Gaming Mouse with Charging Dock

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
review.title: Expensive, but...
review.review: Only had this mouse for a little over a day. Took it out of the box and charged it, got busy and didn't start using it until last night. I can't explain how more responsive and better feel of it. Its like trying to explain the difference between blu ray and dvd. Its definitely there. Its also super comfortable in my hand. I had thought I would take off that side thumb rest but its actually really nice. I like the ability to adjust the scroll wheel resistance too but honestly I wouldn't pay extra for that.The docking bay is cool, its weird how easily the mouse just rests on it. When putting it back at night I had to check a couple times to make sure it was on right. It was, I'm just going to have to trust that it magically just fits in when I haphazardly put it on.The mouse is lighter than I would have expected. Not super light, but lighter than my previous generic logitech mouse and lighter than the M720. This most likely has to do with the lack of inserted batteries though.Speaking of battery life, been working with it for about four hours now and its at 88%. The lights were on. I would have put a criticism about not being able to figure out how to turn them off but I just updated and suddenly the mouse showed up in the chroma program and I was able to turn them off.The only real criticism I have is that when I press the scroll button (depressing the wheel), which I do often in a game I play to auto-run, it tends to scroll forward on click. I think its the placement of it and when I take my finger and press on it more from the front it doesn't do that so it'll be an adjustment.I haven't played with all the little setting, macros, and customizations of the lighting. I probably paid a hefty price for something that I won't use with those but as far as what a mouse is supposed to do, it does it very well.
product.title: Razer Basilisk Ultimate Wireless Gaming Mouse with Charging Dock

review.review_data: Reviewed in Germany on October 13, 2021
review.title: Sehr gute Maus aber man macht Abstriche (Vergleiche mit Cosair DARK Rgb pro)
review.review: Vorweg: ich habe sogut wie mein ganzes setuo von razer (Maus, Mauspad, Tastertur und Kopfhörer) und bin mit dem Ökosystem sehr zufrieden. Die Software funktioniert reibungslos und ist meiner Meinung nach der iCue Software von Cosair überlegen. Die Effekte sind 1A und sehr schnell anpassbar auch was die Tastenbelegung und die Performance angeht macht man da nix falsches.Nun zur Maus und der Station:Man hat im Gegensatz zur Konkurrenz eine leichte Maus was für Shooter sehr angenehm ist. Durch das bundle hatte ich das razer Mauspad dabei und wenn man sich 1-2 Tage an das ganze gewöhnt hat will man praktisch nichts anderes mehr. Die Maus ist sehr ergonomisch auch für Größe Hände. Man hat nahezu keine Latenz (ich merke zu meiner alten Kabelmaus 0 Unterschied)Die Docking Station ist wahnsinnig praktisch und funktioniert gut. Die Akkulaufzeit könnte ehrlich gesagt besser sein aber man kann ganicht so lange zocken wie die Maus leer wird und vollgeladen ist die auch sehr schnell. Für meinen Geschmack hat die Maus 1-2 Tasten zu wenig aber wenn man beim zocken sich schnell umgewöhnt(von mehr zu weniger Tasten) geht das auch fit. Sonst kann man nur sagen das die Maus und die Station eine hohe Qualität hat was eigentlich typisch für razer ist aber man dafür natürlich auch im Gegensatz zur Konkurrenz ein wenig mehr blechen muss.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Great mouse, did research before buying
review.review: I did my research directly on Razer's website to find the mouse that fit my needs best. I was having issues with my previous Razer mouse, only to find that my mousepad was the cause. I actually put away my Mamba Wireless for this mouse because I prefer the soft cord and typically don't gravitate toward wireless for gaming. If you are looking for a wireless mouse, I would recommend the Mamba wireless. For wired, any of Razer's Speedflex models, including this one. I ultimately chose this one and buying here for price and dpi, as I typically game at 9,000 dpi, but like to change that a bit for different games/gameplay types.Overall, would buy again and recommend as a wired mouse. The pink is a nice color to spice up my rig.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Hyperspeed Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - 20K DPI ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Lost Connections, bad lag, poor performance
review.review: I had been looking at this mouse for a while and finally convinced myself to buy one.I was very excited for the new mouse.My somewhat new computer has the RGB fans and lighting, so I was excited to add to my setup with this mouse and mouse dock.Add to this the fact that this is a Razer product (supposedly top tier), I thought I was getting something good.I bought this mouse, received it two days latter, returned it the next day.I let the mouse fully charge before using (per the instructions).Once it was fully charged I started using it for the last part of my work day.I was presenting on a Teams meeting and twice in the hour meeting it lost connection.Luckily I still had my other mouse connected so I was able to use it the second time to finish the meeting.Several other times through the remaining part of the day/evening the mouse would lose connection with the computer, usually requiring me to turn it off then back on again for it to start working.Other times it would lag behind very bad and I would have to wait for it to catch up to what I was trying to do.If this is "hyperspeed" technology, I would hate to see how a normal speed mouse works from Razer.I could not imagine anyone using this for gaming, it is horrible.Finally, I tried to customize the buttons on the mouse through Razer Synapse.I would set the buttons, save the setup, and if I left Razer Synapse open, the buttons would work with no issues.As soon as I closed the Razer application, it is as if the mouse would reset to factory defaults and loose all the settings I had just saved.I tried this multiple times with the same results.I even checked other sites for instructions on how to customize the mouse settings to make sure I was not missing a step, no luck.So, in addition to the loss of connection, and horrible lagging; if I were to keep them mouse I would have to open Razer Synapse every morning, setup the mouse again how I wanted it to be, then leave the application open all day just to make sure it worked as designed.I am new to Razer products like this but not new to computers.I have been working in the IS field for over a decade, and I know how to use, and troubleshoot issues with these devices.This mouse just is not a good mouse and not worth the money at all.Please don't waste your money on this overpriced, underperforming mouse.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Hyperspeed Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - 20K DPI ...
