review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Good, but came broken.
review.review: I received this item and immediately plugged it in and set it up on my desk.It works, it does the basic function it is designed to do (big pad for your mouse and keyboard).I noticed a brighter light just to the left of the plastic piece that says Razer on the pad (see pictures).So I unplugged it and looked at that section.Well, it is broken/torn.Not sure what the deal is with this, I assumed Razer was higher quality, which is why I bought this item instead of other brands.I am glad I had points I was able to use to make this less expensive since it is obviously cheap.I figure I either received a returned item, this is just poor build quality, or poor handling/packaging that caused this to break (or a combination of all the above).Either way, I would not buy it again, and I do not recommend this to anyone.Quality assurance at this company is apparently not something they are concerned with.Additionally, the stitching that holds the LED tube to the mat is very annoying on my skin.not sure how this passed any sort of user testing.After my recent experience with a few of their other products and this item, I clearly will never buy Razer products again.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021
review.title: A very fair mat solution, but wears quickly
review.review: So, I was turned off by all the reports of warping of the EL strips along its sides, but I took the leap and went for it. Happily, in the 9 months of ownership I've had, I can report no warping of the mat: It's as flat as it came on the first day. (...it came rolled up, but.. you know)I like the Extended model for desk coverage. It adds a nice touch to your workspace, and has proven to be easy enough to clean with a damp cloth. The experience has been overall very good.Where it lacks is durability of the cloth skin on the mat. The right hand side (see pic) shows noticeable wear after less than a year of use. This was a disappointment, because if not for that fact I would have given this a no-fault review. A less important nitpick: The single channel EL strip, vs a multi-channel zone strip like what the Firefly uses to produce the wave effect. A mat this large would show off greatly if the EL strip could handle it, IMO.Pictures show a.) the spot on the mat where it's taken notable wear and tear, discoloring and fraying the fabric skin of the mat; and b.) a snapshot of my Goliathus workspace: From left to right: The Razer Charging Pad Chroma, the Blackwidow Chroma v2; the Mouse Dock Chroma; and the Naga Pro. (I like pretty lights.)
product.title: Razer Goliathus Chroma Soft Gaming Mouse Mat Powered by Razer Chroma Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Great mouse, did research before buying
review.review: I did my research directly on Razer's website to find the mouse that fit my needs best. I was having issues with my previous Razer mouse, only to find that my mousepad was the cause. I actually put away my Mamba Wireless for this mouse because I prefer the soft cord and typically don't gravitate toward wireless for gaming. If you are looking for a wireless mouse, I would recommend the Mamba wireless. For wired, any of Razer's Speedflex models, including this one. I ultimately chose this one and buying here for price and dpi, as I typically game at 9,000 dpi, but like to change that a bit for different games/gameplay types.Overall, would buy again and recommend as a wired mouse. The pink is a nice color to spice up my rig.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Hyperspeed Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - 20K DPI ...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Lost Connections, bad lag, poor performance
review.review: I had been looking at this mouse for a while and finally convinced myself to buy one.I was very excited for the new mouse.My somewhat new computer has the RGB fans and lighting, so I was excited to add to my setup with this mouse and mouse dock.Add to this the fact that this is a Razer product (supposedly top tier), I thought I was getting something good.I bought this mouse, received it two days latter, returned it the next day.I let the mouse fully charge before using (per the instructions).Once it was fully charged I started using it for the last part of my work day.I was presenting on a Teams meeting and twice in the hour meeting it lost connection.Luckily I still had my other mouse connected so I was able to use it the second time to finish the meeting.Several other times through the remaining part of the day/evening the mouse would lose connection with the computer, usually requiring me to turn it off then back on again for it to start working.Other times it would lag behind very bad and I would have to wait for it to catch up to what I was trying to do.If this is "hyperspeed" technology, I would hate to see how a normal speed mouse works from Razer.I could not imagine anyone using this for gaming, it is horrible.Finally, I tried to customize the buttons on the mouse through Razer Synapse.I would set the buttons, save the setup, and if I left Razer Synapse open, the buttons would work with no issues.As soon as I closed the Razer application, it is as if the mouse would reset to factory defaults and loose all the settings I had just saved.I tried this multiple times with the same results.I even checked other sites for instructions on how to customize the mouse settings to make sure I was not missing a step, no luck.So, in addition to the loss of connection, and horrible lagging; if I were to keep them mouse I would have to open Razer Synapse every morning, setup the mouse again how I wanted it to be, then leave the application open all day just to make sure it worked as designed.I am new to Razer products like this but not new to computers.I have been working in the IS field for over a decade, and I know how to use, and troubleshoot issues with these devices.This mouse just is not a good mouse and not worth the money at all.Please don't waste your money on this overpriced, underperforming mouse.
product.title: Razer Viper Ultimate Hyperspeed Lightest Wireless Gaming Mouse & RGB Charging Dock: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - 20K DPI ...

I really like the g502, but the scroll wheel thing is dumb and kind of useless. I use that button for remapping, and its kind of important for my muscle memory.The battery life is great, i havent had it die once and i have rgb on, using it for about a week. RND is great on it, good quality, smooth clicks on both main actuators. It fits really nicely in my hand (mostly claw grip, but i rest my palm on the back, medium hands). The pads on the bottom are literal butter. It glides with 0 friction, even on my admittedly worn mouse mat.Honestly a great mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Click away
review.review: Perhaps one of nicest mouse clicking sounds and feeling I have ever heard with hardly any delay between clicks.However a major nitpick I have is when you use the mouse for the first time on a pc it opens up a download prompt for the software which is convenient but distracting when using it on a different pc for the first time (haven't tested it just hypothetically speaking)To use certain features i.e macros you need the software to be installed AND be in the background but overall mouse control you dont need the software.After you figure our your button bindings delete the software then have your pc forget the mouse then reconnect the mouse and close out the download prompt (after you do it once it won't reappear unless you make your pc forget it) This solved the issue I had with it skipping abruptly both in-game and browsing.After these changes its a very solid mouse and felt right at home using it without needing to make any adjustments.Only nitpick I have is that you can't get custom shells individually in the official website or other websites.

review.title: Great Mouse...one annoying flaw!
review.review: I've used logitech mice forever and never thought that I would be able to switch to anything different. I saw some reviews for this right around when my current mouse started acting up. For the price this mouse is insanely good. It is extremely light so if you want a heavy mouse it might not be for you. But it works great in everything i play from shooters to mmo's.My one complaint.... and i'm surprised i haven't seen more of this is the grips they give you. They are just stickers that you put on the right and left side of the mouse (there is also one for each mouse click). After 3 or 4 months they start to peel off at the edges and make the mouse extremely annoying to hold in your hand. If it wasnt for this the mouse would be 5 stars.....i havent really found any sites that sell replacement grips. Why not just build these into the mouse?

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review.title: The mouse is fine, but the mandatory G HUB sofware is awful
review.review: So Logitech decided to discontinue their software for various devices and consolidate them into on grand app to rule them all: G HUB. Not a bad strategy, but the execution was terrible.The mouse itself is pretty good, but there is no point extolling its virtues, since you shouldn't buy it anyway. In fact, you should not buy any Logitech wireless produce until they've fixed G HUB. Or eradicated it, hired a new engineering team, and written something better to replace it. Or, you know, just reverted to the LGS app that their older mice used that worked just fine for years.There are many reviews detailing G HUB's failings, so I won't list all of them here. I'll add my latest experience to the pile:I got the mouse and installed G HUB several months ago on a system with Windows 8.1. Today, I used the in-app button to upgrade to the latest version. But it turns out the latest version is only compatible with Windows 10. So it tried to upgrade itself and hung forever instead, showing me the cutesy animation that Logitech's engineering department apparently spent their time on instead of doing QA. I didn't even get the courtesy of an error message.As a programmer myself, I can tell you that's an inexcusable, novice, facepalm-grade error. An auto-updater should *always* perform proper version and requirements checks.Anyway, I headed to Logitech's site to find an installer for the earlier Windows 8 compatible version. I knew it existed, since just an hour before it was up and running on my system. But no luck, they now offer Windows 10 or Mac only. So then off to reddit, where quickly I found the hidden link to the older Win7 and Win8 versions. Pay no mind to the "There are no Downloads for this Version" message! It's there, or at least it was today, though it may be gone by the time you need it.That installer then failed because it was confused by the current, corrupt installation. So I spent some time ripping that one out by the roots from multiple file system and registry locations. After pausing for a moment to say goodbye to the mouse settings/macros I spent time writing, now all gone, I was able to reinstall it.The whole affair reminded me of this bit from the HHGTTG:“But the plans were on display…”“On display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.”“That’s the display department.”“With a flashlight.”“Ah, well, the lights had probably gone.”“So had the stairs.”“But look, you found the notice, didn’t you?”“Yes,” said Arthur, “yes I did. It was on display in the bottom of a locked filing cabinet stuck in a disused lavatory with a sign on the door saying ‘Beware of the Leopard.”

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Can't Recommend
review.review: This mouse has really been a disappointment.Battery life is nowhere near what I was expecting. I replace batteries in my M510 maybe every 8 month's. That mouse is used 8 hours a day for work. Since I got this in July I have had to replace the batteries three times already (almost monthly).Functionally, this mouse would be terrible for any type of FPS. Half the time the first click I make doesn't register and I have to click again. I haven't experienced the double clicks that others have reported, but they may only be a matter of time. The two main buttons overhang the front of the mouse, so if you bump it into anything while moving it, you end up with random clicks.And last but definitely not least, the G-Hub software is absolute garbage. The interface is terrible and difficult to use. Nothing is where you expect it be and you have to click thru different screens to do basic things like remap buttons. It is buggy as hell, locking up when trying to update, requiring uninstalling and reinstalling it to get it to work. Half the time the profiles you get put in and saved don't activate when they should. For G-Hub alone I would say to stay away from any Logitech product that uses it.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Excellent physical design, absolutely unusable due to GHub.
review.review: I had my previous Logitech gaming mouse for almost 10-years before it gave up on life. So I went for this G604.It feels great in my hand, cradles my thumb perfectly and the buttons are all accessible for my tiny lady hands. Excellent design!But... The Ghub software? Randomly drops profiles so none of the programmed buttons work. Just randomly. It makes the mouse totally unusable. I will be in the middle of a project I rely on macro'd buttons to do for work? Mouse decides to stop working. I will be gaming and try to hit a macro? Bam! Dead!Trying to find a way to load the profile onboard is obtuse. This mouse is harder to program than units with more buttons were 10-years ago.Thing is, I trusted Logitech enough to throw out the package so I cannot even return this failure of a device. Ghub will spend hours trying to update and fail to, which leads to uninstalling and reinstalling just to use the %^&%^ mouse to do basic ^&%&^ mouse things. I have never had this kind of issue with Logitech devices and I have been a loyal customer for decades.Looks like I will be dropping $300 to buy a new copy of the same Logitech gaming mouse I got 10-years ago, because I know that it will survive being used for 16-hours a day for close to 10-years and remain a viable, reliable option until USB technology is completely phased out of PCs.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: You get what you pay for
review.review: Where does all your money go and why is it so much? That's the $150 question for everybody. The TLDR is that it's incredibly well built, fully wireless, responsive, and the lightest mouse on the market. And it's pearly white.I don't know what other relevant details I can give. This mouse has been stress-tested by the best in the tech. industry and Logitech weren't lying, this mouse is FAST. It has incredibly low latency, very good battery life (I mean...there's zero RGB lighting), and is quite possibly the safest shape a mouse can come in. If you don't consider your hands much larger or smaller than most people, it will probably be comfortable holding this mouse.The visual design is intelligent. It has this elegance that isn't the embarrassing "gamer" stylings of other products but isn't so minimalistic that you wouldn't immediately recognize this mouse at first glance. Anybody who's ever used this mouse knows exactly what this feels and looks like.Is this mouse necessary? Absolutely not. I think the only thing more over-the-top than this mouse is the amount of R&D and feedback Logitech went through to create one of the best mice in PC gaming. I do prefer the Razer Viper Ultimate over this because I prefer the texture and shape. I am also bothered that a $150 computer mouse looks almost too simple. Also, in my opinion, the Viper Ultimate doesn't feel that much heavier than this. I wanted to note that, in case anybody wanted a cheaper alternative.Overall, this mouse is a flex, or for anybody who wants to go out of their way to spend time and money on their gaming hobby (gaming career maybe?). I considered buying this since it launched and was not disappointed. Here's to hoping I get my $150 out of this mouse.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Great quality mouse, but not for everyone
review.review: I believe this mouse is made out of great quality. No creaking in the frame, mouse feet are very smooth, is very light for being wireless, and the sensor is great! But there are two things that really bother me about this mouse that has made me sell this mouse and buy another mouse. First, the switches are terrible. They are cheap Omron switches that do not feel as good as other switches (i.e Razer Viper Mini, which is ironic because it costs $30). If you are going to buy this mouse, learn soldering skills and switch these out for some Kailh 4.0 or 8.0 switches. Second (and biggest issue for me), the shape. When you first grip this mouse, you feel like you are gripping a potato. I have medium sized hands (17 x 9.5 CM or 6 3/4" x 3 1/4" IN) and I prefer to claw grip my mice, which I cannot comfortably claw grip this mouse because it is too long and too tall for my hands. If you have medium sized hands in length, fingertip or palm grip this mouse but don't claw grip this mouse. If you have large hands (especially in length), I highly recommend this mouse because you can claw and fingertip this mouse comfortably, and maybe even palm grip. If you have small hands, there are better sized mice for you guys.

After using it for several hours, I realized how great of a mouse it is. I love the non-RGB "feature" too! Dialing back RGB makes everything look better. The slides are great, the optional grips are amazing, its just a very solid mouse.With the battery, it charges extremely fast and so far after about 7 hours of use, it's gone down 1%!The last thing I'll say is its amazing the weight without having to resort to honeycomb where they literally make the actual shell itself porous which is simply a bad idea all around. You get the extreme light weight (which I actually love!) mixed with durability and protection.There is nothing I can say about this mouse thats bad so far.. I really am more impressed with it than I thought I would be.Would recommend 10/10

review.title: Has Optical Switches
review.review: I'm not a gamer but I use a DAW a lot and there are many settings and adjustments to make on plug-ins, etc. It doesn't take long to wear out a mouse with contact switches. Regular contact switches bounce from day one and the bounce increases with wear until you get double-clicks and multiple clicks which cause errors and results other than what you want. I just wanted this mouse for the optical switch, which has no bounce. However, to get the driver, you have to install bloatwear and nagwear.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2021
review.title: Great Product and Company - Amazon Dropped the Ball
review.review: Amazon completely dropped the ball on this order by delivering me one damaged and one defective copy of the mouse. They insisted that I talk to the manufacturer despite there still being a prime guarantee for a non-returnable product. (I am not sure why this product is classified as non-returnable in the first place when the black version is.)HOWEVER, Ninjutso went above and beyond in providing excellent service and provided me with a replacement once I told them the details. Their service is better than Amazon, so please buy the product without any worries of amazon potentially failing you.Review of the mouse itself:The mouse hits all the important points that modern mice these days need. It is lightweight yet still has a sturdy build, excellent feeling clicks, and a coating that is easy on the hands. The shape is the old school intellimouse shape, with slight adjustments to make it even more comfortable for smaller/medium size hands.My only gripe about the mouse is the sensor - a PAW3335 which is known to have issues - but the implementation was great on this mouse. Ninjutso are aware of this, and plan an updated version so keep a look out for that one as well.Overall, I highly recommend the product not just for the quality itself, but also the friendly nature of the company as well.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: TERRIBLE. Scroll Wheel WILL Start to Squeak and Fail After 3 Months.
review.review: For the first few months, it was good. Everything worked as it should. The cord was not a problem and extended long enough to reach my tower. I enjoyed having two buttons on the side for gaming purposes. The mouse fits nicely in your hand. The scroll wheel and the design light up a pretty white hue. Aesthetically pleasing and matches my white set-up.BUT. After 3 months, just this past September, the scroll wheel started to make this OBNOXIOUS screeching sound every time I scrolled. I didn't realize how much I scroll until this started to happen. It was ear aching and I looked up how to fix it, saw that MANY others with this mouse had a similar problem, and the fix requires you to dissemble the whole thing to oil it. I am not savvy with that so I left it alone in hopes that it would just go away with time.Well the squeaking has reduced but now everytime I attempt to scroll, it causes my window to jitter and scroll back the OPPOSITE way. So here I am battling with my mouse to scroll smoothly for just a couple inches. It's the most frustrating thing I've experienced with a mouse and I've finally given up and am purchasing a different one. I never had a mouse that couldn't even last a single year... this is a poor product in my opinion.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Side-grade to the V2. Great if you never owned the V2 / Razer Basilisk Ultimate.
review.review: When compared to the V2 / Razer Basilisk Ultimate , after 1 week of use:TLDR - Scroll wheel and LED upgrades are good.But... the +/- resistance option for the scroll wheel on the underside of the mouse is now gone. I'm not a fan of the changes to the button internal switches and how they feel or sound.Pros: I like the changes to the scroll wheel. No complaints there. I like that they finally copied one of the features I loved about older Logitech mice. The LED zones on the bottom of the mouse are sweet for you RGB fans (which you probably area if you are buying this).Cons: (It's hard to know if these are little defects with the specific mouse I got, or all V3s are like this). I'm not a huge fan of these upgraded switches for the buttons. I liked the way the V2 felt and sounded better. These are louder and require more force to press. The thumb buttons for forward/back or buttons 3 and 4, feel and sound different from each other. It really annoys me. And the new version of the button 5 or the sniper button, feels worse than the V2 for sure. The button has farther travel distance, feels more mushy, and does not press smoothly. Pressing it feels like the bottom side of the button angles down more than the top. I also hoped this button would be closer to your thumb than it was with V2, which for me always felt too far away and I would need to adjust my whole hang to press it. With the V3, for better or worse, its in the same exact place as the V2.I'm actually debating buying another one to see if the switches feel or sound any better, and then return the worse of the two.The +/- resistance option for the scroll wheel on the underside of the mouse is now gone. No way to adjust resistance. I really wish they had kept that feature.Some people wont like the change to the weight, but I wont mind it.With all that said, if you never owned the V2 / Razer Basilisk Ultimate, you'll be happy with this mouse.
product.title: Razer Basilisk V3 Customizable Ergonomic Gaming Mouse: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 26K DPI Optical...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021
review.title: A better wired V2, but with some slight setbacks
review.review: The infinite scroll wheel is awesome to have especially for someone like me who's switching over from a Logitech MX Master. The Basilisk's shape isn't as comfortable for my hands as that mouse, mainly because it's lacking a little in size compared to the MX. This mouse is much nicer for gaming though as there are more DPI options, and honestly the clicks seem a little more responsive for gaming.The software control for this mouse is good, but I feel it's not as responsive as the wired Basilisk V2 that I had was. This is mainly with regards to Razer's Chroma software. I tried to have the bottom portion of LEDs disabled, but it can be pretty laggy or buggy as an effect. The main reason why I tried to turn off the bottom portion of RGB lights is because it can be pretty distracting. The lighting around that area looks totally badass, but the reflection it makes against the surface looks kind of ugly. Honestly, I think V2 looks a little bit more classy because it's not leaving an RGB shadow behind by default.Still I think the V3 is overall a better upgrade over the V2 because of the infinite scroll wheel. If you don't mind the flashier RGB, this will give you the same comfort as the V2, but with more versatile functionality.
product.title: Razer Basilisk V3 Customizable Ergonomic Gaming Mouse: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 26K DPI Optical...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2021
review.title: Great potential but...
review.review: I was a super big fan of the Basilisk V2 the only problems I had with it were the left and right buttons being shaky, luckily this was fixed with the Basilisk V3. But after about a month of the Basilisk V3, I have run into many problems like slam clicking, the sensor spinning out and the mouse wheel detecting movement on its own. (no infinite scroll wheel is not on) I wanted to love this mouse but with these problems, I just can't. Looking past the defects that I have experienced I still hate that it weighs heavier than the V2. You can debate if having an infinite scroll wheel is useful enough to an extra 10+ grams. Sadly I will be returning this mouse.
product.title: Razer Basilisk V3 Customizable Ergonomic Gaming Mouse: Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 26K DPI Optical...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2021
review.title: Works beautifully
review.review: I moved to the V3 after using the V2 for the last six months.Loved everything about this mouse before, and with the new scroll wheel it is significantly better.The only thing that was not necessary for me was the new lighting under the mouse, but I can't full fault it if that's your bag.An absolute must buy for any one who likes this mouse style.
